review_title: A College going through a difficult time with struggling leadership
pros:
Great location: Southern Alberta is one of the best places in Canada to live and work.
The College has some great instructors who really care about their classes, students and subjects.
cons: The college is struggling with its vision and budget. Its operating model is on cost-containment rather than educational innovation or visionary leadership. The result is antiquated technology and a preoccupation on student retention leading the college to view its role as providing education to those students who don't have the ability to be successful at the local university.

pros: Good pay and benefits. Three months off per summer.
cons: Although a public college, Lethbridge's College primary focus is to retain tuition revenue rather than provide a quality education. The overriding concern of management is to "never fail" a student so that they won't drop out and we will be able to get another semester of tuition revenue from them. Students who don't do any work, or who don't show up for exams should be given a pass anyway for this reason.

pros: People who are independently wealthy and/ or have a wealthy spouse to support them while they are working for free for years on end, in order to secure a permanent position will enjoy hanging out at the college.
cons: No benefits, retirement or job security for anyone other than tenured employees which the college is striving to eliminate.

review_title: Great place for benefits and PD
pros: Many opportunities for professional development. Great benefits. Great people.
cons: Culture is getting better but could use more attention. Senior management is trying but this must trickle to middle management as well.  Varies widely across departments. Salary raises are currently blocked  making pay  grades low in some areas.

pros: Many of the staff have been at the College  for a long time which is always a good sign of a good employer. The staff are all great to work with.
cons: Red tape is always an issue when working in an educational institution. It can sometimes be hard to get your ideas listened to.

pros: Amazing culture, the time is flexible, you get to meet a lot of people and students from around the world
cons: I did not find any cons, I really enjoyed working for them.  They know what they're doing, everything is organized.

review_title: Inclusive and open to new ideas
pros: Inclusive and open to new ideas
cons: Few opportunities for growth once reached "middle" before senior leadership.
